column3: str
Nigen is worried for her husband.
Speak with Nigen's husband.
Use the thick ropes to capture two weakened steppe dzos.
Report to Nigen's husband.
Report to Nigen.
Hello again! My brother and sister are both doing very well thanks to your aid. There is actually something else I would like you to help me with should you have the time.
We are a tribe of nomads, periodically dismantling our tents and moving from area to area. Each time we require a group of steppe dzos to transport our homes.
My husband is currently trying to catch some to the south. He must be struggling otherwise he would have come back by now.
Please go and help him.
Please go and help my husband. You will find him to the south.
Oh, have you come to help? We will take care of this smaller dzo.
As you look a considerable amount stronger than any of us, could I ask you to catch two of the beasts? Weaken them first, and then tie them up with this rope.
Would you be able to catch two steppe dzos? Weaken them first, and then tie them up with this rope.
Were you able to find my husband? I am sure he would appreciate your help.
You are a natural! Thank you so much.
I will help guide the dzos back to Mol Iloh. By all means, please head back first. I am sure my wife would like to thank you as well.
Did everything go smoothly?
Wonderful to hear. You were not injured by the dzos, were you?
Capturing the beasts is never easy, but we have little choice. There is no way we alone could ever bear the weight of our tents.
Please take this for your troubles. Thank you once again.
